{"step_by_step_thinking": "The Ellis and Deway classification is used to classify traumatic fractures of the teeth. It categorizes fractures into three main types: Ellis I, Ellis II, and Ellis III. Ellis I fractures involve only the enamel, Ellis II fractures involve the enamel and dentin, and Ellis III fractures involve the enamel, dentin, and pulp. Therefore, the answer is C. 3.", "answer_choice": "C"}
